image.altText: A bush stone-curlew sits in a grassy field wearing a tiny GPS tracker backpack.

props.synopsis: Originally a community idea to reintroduce bush stone-curlews in Canberra, the project has now grown and expanded to Victoria where the birds are being successfully reintroduced with the help of tiny handmade backpacks.

title.children: Bush stone-curlews are being fitted with backpacks to study their behaviour

image.altText: a woman sitting on an outdoor couch in a brightly-patterned top next to a brown border collie

props.synopsis: It's a far from uncommon situation. But what can you actually do if the neighbour's dog just won't stop barking?

title.children: How to deal with a neighbour's nuisance barking dog (and keep things cordial)

image.altText: a woman sets a table in a restaurant

props.synopsis: Caitlin Baker is an accomplished sommelier, but that doesn't mean she's always treated respectfully by customers or colleagues.

title.children: 'I want to talk to a man': Female hospitality workers call out sexism

image.altText: A woman in a khaki button-down wiping off the leaves of a palm in a tropical greenhouse.

props.synopsis: For about two hours every week, the Squishy Vols, as they're known, meet for some meditative manual labour to squish bugs and scrape scale from plants in the glasshouses at the Australian National Botanic Gardens in Canberra.

title.children: These volunteers are searching for malicious pests in a bid to preserve treasured Australian plants

image.altText: An old black-and-white image of soldiers in world war one.

props.synopsis: A veterans' group in regional NSW is searching for stories of First Nations soldiers who fought for Australia to finally give them the recognition they deserve.

title.children: Aunty Cheryl has found the 'lost' history of her Indigenous Anzac ancestors

image.altText: A white man runs with a group of Thai children, all are wearing yellow shirts. One kid is high fiving the man.

props.synopsis: After the 2004 Boxing Day tsunami, forensic investigator Peter Baines wanted to create good from the enormity of loss. Twenty years on, he has raised $30 million for children orphaned by the disaster.

title.children: The forensic officer who changed lives after 2004 Boxing Day tsunami

image.altText: An Australian runner leads a group of runners across the line in her Olympic heat.

props.synopsis: Athletics made the headlines in Australia multiple times in 2024 because the athletes stepped up to another level, catching the attention and the imagination of the nation.

title.children: 2024 a great year for Australian athletics, and all signs point to it getting better

image.altText: Two police officers walk near the scene of the collision in Kambah.

props.synopsis: A 75-year-old woman has died after a single vehicle crash in Canberra's south.

title.children: Woman dies after single vehicle crash in Canberra parking lot

image.altText: Rohit Sharma, Steve Smith and Sam Konstas

props.synopsis: Rohit Sharma's elevation to open marks another failure with the bat, while Steve Smith stands tall and Sam Konstas has the fans eating out of the palm of his hand. Here are the quick hits from day two at the MCG.

title.children: Five quick hits: India skipper struggling as Konstas conducts MCG crowd

props.synopsis: 2024 shook the world in more ways than one. From politics to pop culture, climate to conflict, 2024 was a year of tumbling records — but not always for the best reasons.

title.children: From Bitcoin and Ozempic to Taylor Swift, charts reveal why 2024 broke records

image.altText: A fire outside a window

props.synopsis: The director of the hospital alleges IDF troops have been burning operating theatres in the facility, which Israel says is a 'Hamas terrorist stronghold'.

title.children: IDF forces raid one of the last hospitals functioning in northern Gaza

image.altText: Alshad Ahmad kisses a tiger through the thick, green metal bars of an animal cage.

props.synopsis: He has four Bengal tigers in his collection, but with his Khakis and a dream to one day turn the expanding menagerie on his sprawling family property into a farm, Alshad Ahmad shuns comparisons to Joe Exotic and says his inspiration is legendary Australian "crocodile hunter" Steve Irwin.

title.children: Inside this Indonesian mansion, a YouTube star lives with four tigers

image.altText: asian man wearing suit speaking at conference

props.synopsis: The decision to impeach the acting president comes after the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol earlier this month.

title.children: South Korean MPs vote to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo

image.altText: A spacecraft heading into the Sun

props.synopsis: Scientists hope the data from Parker will help them better understand the inner workings of the Sun.

title.children: NASA's Parker probe survives close encounter with the Sun

props.synopsis: If Brad Battin is to be a successful leader, he'll need to show magnanimity in the coming weeks as he pulls together his shadow cabinet.

title.children: Brad Battin needs to win over the Victorian Liberals who didn't vote for him

image.altText: Ezra Mam leaves court in a suit

props.synopsis: Brisbane star Ezra Mam has accepted a nine-game NRL ban for his driving charges, while a $90,000 club fine has taken his financial penalties to $120,000.

title.children: Ezra Mam accepts nine-game ban, $120,000 in fines

image.altText: Beatriz Haddad Maia grimaces

props.synopsis: Beatriz Haddad Maia suffered severe cramping and was unable to serve in her three hour epic with Xinyu Gao. Earlier, former Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina leads Kazakhstan to a battling 2-1 victory over Spain as the United Cup gets underway in Perth.

title.children: Brazilian star freezes from cramp, forced to serve underarm in three-hour epic

image.altText: Sebastian Zapeta, accused of setting a woman on fire inside a New York City subway train, appears in court,

props.synopsis: The man accused of burning a sleeping woman to death inside a New York City subway train has been indicted on murder and arson charges, prosecutors announced on Friday, as authorities continue working to identify the victim.

title.children: Man charged following burning death of woman in New York City subway train

image.altText: A woman with a bouffant chats to a blonde woman in a pale blue evening gown

props.synopsis: From the Taylor Swift fans who made the most out of missing out on Eras tickets, to Princess Diana's unlikely confidant, these summer reads might be just what you need.

title.children: Taylor Swift fans, the middle class and Princess Diana: here are the ABC's best long reads of 2024

image.altText: man standing at lectern in front of a yellow and red flag with a bird on it

props.synopsis: Frank-Walter Steinmeier dissolved the country's lower house and set the date for a snap election following the collapse of the three-way coalition.

title.children: Germany's president dissolves parliament ahead of snap election

image.altText: Mother, child and father in front of a car with writing on it saying 'thank you emergency services'

props.synopsis: Amid the turmoil of evacuations, residents in western Victoria have provided shelter, food and Christmas cheer to those in need.

title.children: How Victorians opened their homes to bushfire evacuees this week

image.altText: three teenage boys wearing traditional red lap laps and white body paint stand together

props.synopsis: Gippsland's Boorun Boys are reclaiming their cultural heritage, preserving ancient songlines and creating new ones as they honour their ancestors through dance.

title.children: Boys create original songlines to preserve and pass down 60,000 years of culture

image.altText: Man with star headband takes photo of fireworks

props.synopsis: Amid the final preparations for the New Year's Eve fireworks in Sydney, organisers have assured visitors that plans for public transport remain a priority.

title.children: Final days of Sydney NYE fireworks preparation underway

image.altText: A police officer keeps watch as people remove flower bouquets

props.synopsis: The driver who rammed his car into a crowd in southern China's Zhuhai city has been sentenced to death, China's official Xinhua News Agency reported on Friday.

title.children: Chinese man sentenced to death for killing 35 people in car ramming attack

image.altText: Water pours out of a tap  into someone's hand in a desert community.

props.synopsis: The NT Court of Appeal has upheld a ruling that the territory government is legally responsible for providing safe drinking water in remote communities. Lawyers say the decision could have implications for a wider class action on remote housing.

title.children: Court upholds NT remote tenants' right to clean drinking water

image.altText: Lifeguard North Avoca

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy was knocked into the water by a powerful wave on Christmas Eve and disappeared. A body believed to be that of the teenage boy has been found.

title.children: Body found in search for missing teenager at NSW's North Avoca Beach

image.altText: Finland's white and blue border coast guard ship on a dark sea in front of the a black oil tanker

props.synopsis: The Nordic country's National Bureau of Investigation says the ship is suspected of towing an anchor that caused damage to a source of electricity powering Estonia.

title.children: Finland seizes tanker suspected of causing underwater power cable outage

image.altText: People stand around a car with all its doors open with a sign in beg letters on the wall behind reading BYD.

props.synopsis: More than 160 Chinese nationals working to build a factory for Chinese EV giant BYD are victims of human trafficking, according to Brazilian labour authorities.

title.children: Workers building BYD factory are victims of trafficking, Brazil says

image.altText: A red header moves along a paddock harvesting grain with a truck following behind.

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers have grappled with a series of uncontrollable weather conditions that have created one of the most challenging seasons on record.

title.children: South Australian farmers count their losses after worst season in decades

image.altText: A close up of a blonde woman's face

props.synopsis: In a social media ecosystem already rife with misogyny, racism and aggression, experts say it's remarkably easy to shape the narrative around a public figure through "astroturfing".

title.children: Blake Lively is not the first star to allegedly be targeted by 'astroturfing'

image.altText: Chloe Jade Mason 2

props.synopsis: Police have released CCTV footage in a public appeal for more information about the shooting murder of Chloe Jade Mason in a suburban street north of Brisbane on Sunday.

title.children: CCTV appeal after shooting murder of 23-year-old woman north of Brisbane

image.altText: Photo of nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: One of Australia's closest neighbours proposes 29 locations for nuclear power plants across the archipelago, but critics say the plan is "dangerous".

title.children: Concerns over Indonesia's nuclear power plans as 29 sites proposed

image.altText: John Pesutto looks up in a determined fashion, standing in front of a shelf of books inside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Six years ago, John Pesutto told Liberal colleagues they had to make sure it was "not about us". Today, his colleagues replaced him as leader after a months-long saga that had become all about him.

title.children: John Pesutto waited years to lead Victoria's Liberal Party. In one vote, the dream ended

image.altText: Busy Main Beach at Noosa in January 2022

props.synopsis: Summer is a bumper time of year for coastal communities, but not every town is happy with the influx of holiday crowds as pollution, traffic and waste put a strain on local infrastructure.

title.children: 'They use the bush as a toilet': Beach towns struggling with overtourism
